item.title: Poems
item.description: Most of these poems were written during fall 2023 for the class 21W.771, taught by Prof. Erica Funkhouser. The painting on the cover is L’Estaque by Paul Cézanne. Vertigo From dizzying heights, the earth we once knew drifted into a sea of whispers. Not snow-capped peaks, nor treacherous straits could stop us anymore. We flew over the town in half-light. Soft shadows scaled the low walls. The place where every road began.

item.title: About
item.description: My name is Zifan Wang (王子凡). I mostly go by Atticus. Yes, it was inspired by that novel. I’m a sophomore at MIT studying pure math, primarily interested in homotopy theory and algebraic geometry. Right now, I’m learning chromatic homotopy theory. I also dabble in physics and machine learning. Recently I became interested in formalizing mathematics using Lean. In a parallel universe, I may be a guitarist, a chemist, or a writer.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Notes I put all my math notes in one file. It is, of course, a work in progress. Comments and suggestions are very much appreciated. Currently I am learning: Chromatic homotopy theory Geometric quantization D-modules Talk to me if you want to recommend a book, share ideas, chat, or read something together!
